thread.title: Ukranian Firm, CEO to Pay $30 Million to Settle SEC Charges
thread.title_full: Ukranian Firm, CEO to Pay $30 Million to Settle SEC Charges - WSJ

author: Chelsey Dulaney
title: Ukranian Firm, CEO to Pay $30 Million to Settle SEC Charges
text:
A Ukrainian-based firm and its chief executive agreed to pay $30 million to the Securities and Exchange Commission to settle allegations that, for five years, it traded on information from illegally obtained news releases, the SEC said Monday.
The SEC has accused Jaspen Capital Partners Ltd. and its chief executive, Andriy Supranonok, of making $25 million by trading on news releases stolen from two newswire services before the releases were publicly distributed between 2010 and 2014. They also are accused of making...
